title: Grade 10 Mathematics: Quadratic Equations Test

questions.question: Which of the following is a quadratic equation?
Solve the following quadratic equation by factoring: x^2 - 5x + 6 = 0
What is the discriminant of the quadratic equation 2x^2 - 4x + 1 = 0?
Use the quadratic formula to solve the equation: x^2 + 2x - 8 = 0. Show your working.
questions.answer: x = 2, x = -4 (working must show application of the quadratic formula)

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true about the roots of the equation x^2 + 4x + 4 = 0?
options: The equation has two distinct real roots.
The equation has one real root (repeated).
The equation has no real roots.
The equation has three real roots.
questions.answer: The equation has one real root (repeated).

answer_key:
1. B
2. x = 2, x = 3
3. B
4. x = 2, x = -4 (working must be shown)
5. B
